CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper August 30, 1958, pg. 4, reads: "Sin Den Murder Site - During a dispute over the purchase of a drink for a woman, 29-year-old Jonathan Cobbs of 701 Chauncey St., was killed by a stab wound in the chest from a knife in the hands of Raymond Bryant, 30, of Arthur St., early Sunday morning on the porch of the Juicy Plum Club (left photo), a speakeasy, located on the second floor of this building at 1719 Centre Ave. and Roberts St., according to police. Entrance to the steps leading into the club is gained through a doorway in an eight-foot high wooden fence on the Roberts St. side of the building. The right photo shows the Roberts St. side back entrance to the after-hours sin den, with arrow pointing to door and peephole. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Wooden entrance to Juicy Plum Club speakeasy behind 1719 Centre Avenue on Roberts Street, Hill District
